Build ID: I20070621-1340

Steps To Reproduce:
While trying to perform a query:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.mylyn.web.core.WebCorePlugin.getProxyService(WebCorePlugin.java:58)
	at org.eclipse.mylyn.web.core.WebClientUtil.getPlatformProxy(WebClientUtil.java:203)
	at org.eclipse.mylyn.tasks.core.TaskRepository.getProxy(TaskRepository.java:423)
	at org.eclipse.mylyn.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaClientManager.getClient(BugzillaClientManager.java:37)
	at org.eclipse.mylyn.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaRepositoryConnector.performQuery(BugzillaRepositoryConnector.java:380)

More information:
Looking at the source code, it's clear that the WebCorePlugin assumes that it's going to be running from inside of an OSGi environment. However, I'm running headlessly - no OSGi, no bundles, no activation, nada.

According to http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Mylyn_Integrator_Reference, this is supposed to be a supported configuration: "The provisional Bugzilla API can be used independently of the Eclipse Workbench and Mylar UI facilities as a Java API to Bugzilla."

Is there a workaround? Some way to avoid this code path, or fake bundle activation?...

Morphing this bug to reflect the real problem - the document in this bug's URL contain some misleading or outright incorrect examples, and should probably be updated. Things I've found so far:

1) You MUST call repository.setPropertyTaskRepository.PROXY_USEDEFAULT, "false" ), since proxies of any kind are only available in the OSGi container.

2) There's no such method as createTaskFromExistingKey(), nor is there any such class as AbstractRepositoryTask.
